Ruselectronics, part of state-owned Rostec, will produce the Russian answer to the iPhone, the head of the electronics company, Igor Kozlov, said.
Russia's answer to the iPhone will go on sale in 2018 for a starting price of only $130, the country's state news agency TASS has reported.
"In 2018, we will have our own, domestic iPhone, which will cost only about $130," Kozlov said on Thursday.
He told reporters the phone would be comparable in quality with the Apple smartphone - but far cheaper.
